narrative: A resilient quarter underpinned by the bank's diversified business model, with Wealth Management emerging as the standout performer on record AUM and strong net new flows. Canadian P&C benefited from robust mortgage and business lending volumes, though competitive pricing pressures weighed on margins. U.S. Retail remains a work-in-progress, with management executing on strategic repositioning toward affluent segments while absorbing elevated provision expenses. Credit quality held up better than expected, particularly in the closely-watched commercial real estate portfolio where conservative underwriting continues to limit new impaired loan formations. Management signaled confidence in achieving positive operating leverage by year-end as expense growth moderates and digital adoption gains drive efficiency improvements.
